alert.note: Alert for Madison (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 10:16PM CDT until March 26 at 2:12PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Missouri, including the following counties, Iron, Madison and Reynolds. * WHEN...Until 615 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1016 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported ongoing flooding across the warned area near Fredericktown, Potosi, Lesterville, and Bonne Terre. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fredericktown, Ironton, Reynolds, Ellington, Pilot Knob, Viburnum, Arcadia, Annapolis, Junction City, Cobalt, Marquand, Glover, Belleview, Roselle, Saco, Oates, Bixby, Garwood, Buckhorn and Centerville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
